text:
noobie to Julia, trying to get IJulia set up now. I have installed IJulia, but when I try to start the Kernel in Jupyter, I get the following error:
```KernelRestarter: restarting kernel (1/5), new random ports
ERROR: LoadError: ArgumentError: Package IJulia not found in current path:- Run `import Pkg; Pkg.add("IJulia")` to install the IJulia package.

Stacktrace: 
[1] require(::Module, ::Symbol) at ./loading.jl:893 
[2] include(::Function, ::Module, ::String) at ./Base.jl:380 
[3] include(::Module, ::String) at ./Base.jl:368 
[4] exec_options(::Base.JLOptions) at ./client.jl:296 
[5] _start() at ./client.jl:506in expression starting at .julia/packages/IJulia/IDNmS/src/kernel.jl:1```

text: `] add IJulia`  then `] build IJulia` then `using IJulia` then `notebook()`

Ah, I had done this, but it seems the problem was I cannot run this through my other jupyter session, they have to be separate. Thanks!

I don't know the etiquette on this channel, I can remove this post if it is clogging up the feed.

text: I have no idea how to get a julia kernel into other jupyter installations

elements.text: I have no idea how to get a julia kernel into other jupyter installations

text:
It has been a while (and I cannot test this now) but when I last needed to run Julia from a separate Jupyter install I did the following:
`using IJulia`
`ENV["JUPYTER"] = "[path to jupyter install]"`
`] add IJulia`
Then open jupyter directly (rather than from a julia repl) and Julia will be in the kernel menu.
